text: The Tactual Performance Test (TPT) is a neuropsychological test that attempts to measure motor abilities and the recall of motor stimuli. This test requires the use of a blindfold, which taxes subsystems involved in motor and motor- memory.Tactual Performance Test - Springer The TPT is also included in the Halstead-Reitan Neuropsychological Battery.Reitan, Ralph (1985). Halstead- Reitan Neuropsychological Test Battery: Theory and Clinical Interpretation. Tucson, Arizona: Reitan Neuropsychology. . == References == Category:Neuropsychological tests
title: Tactual performance test
